text: Hello everyone, I need to make a POST call on an external API each time I have a change on a contact properties, I wonder which way is the best to do that. I have several hypothesis : a connected app triggered by a custom behavioural event OR a webhook triggered with Zappier that is based on a custom list. I’m curious to have your views on that !

thanks for reply, I did make sure, as mentioned, to include properties I expect in response, but I do not get discount property in response, even though it exists in HubSpot, and I included it in parameters form on request.
What could be the issue ?

Hello !! :slightly_smiling_face:
When I retrieve all custom objects, I can’t differentiate custom objects that have been deleted from live ones. Has anyone been able to bypass this issue ?
The property archived does not give any info unfortunately..
Thanks for your help !!
<@U03MLCLS5BN> I know you're absolutely slammed these next for days but when you get a chance would you mind mentioning this to the technical writing team
After Extend this week I will jump on this! Apologies for any inconvenience, folks!
I am trying to pull a list of all properties in a portal that are configured to be used in forms - is there an API endpoint w/ a filter for that?
I see a Get All Properties endpoint for the Contacts/Companies properties but nothing that allows me to specify only getting the fields that are able to be used in forms

Hola! podrían ayudarme por favor, tengo una formulario en una pagina web y me gustaría que estos datos que llenen los clientes queden registrados en el CRM de HubSpot, el form esta creado en React. Podrían contarme como hacerlo? Gracias

Hi there, I’m using the contacts search api:
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/search>```
Is there a way to further segment the list based upon associated company properties?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
Let me know if you need any help with it
And if you want to get even crazier you could use graphql, but it sounds like the current apis will work for your usecase
Hi, Is there a way to subscribe users to receive emails via the API? Thanks in advance
<@U044VLH18R2> Heck yeah
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing-api/subscriptions-preferences>
Thank you
For sure
Got it so if the company property i’m looking to use as a filter is called “member_status” and it is a radio select and i’m looking for “active”

It’d be

“propertyName”: “association.company”, “member_status”

“operator”: “EQ”,
“value”: Active

for the first line I believe it's going to be:
`"propertyName":"association.company.member_status"`
I haven't run a test yet though so it might need a little tweaking
Hola. Alguien le ha pasado que cuando trata de enviar datos de una fuente externa a HubSpot por medio de una aplicación privada le sale el error que la hapikey no exite? Saben como resolverlo
